name: xpipe
description: xpipe is a self-hosted tool and GUI for managing remote connections and development environments. It centralizes SSH, containers, and tunneling, giving developers a consistent interface across projects and machines.
features: Connection management: Store and organize SSH, Docker, Kubernetes, and other remote connections in a unified interface.
Shell integration: Launch terminal sessions directly from the GUI with saved credentials and connection profiles.
File browser: Navigate remote filesystems with a graphical file manager that supports drag-and-drop transfers.
Container access: Connect to Docker containers and Kubernetes pods without memorizing complex CLI commands.
Tunnel management: Create and manage SSH tunnels and port forwards through an intuitive visual interface.
Script execution: Run saved scripts across multiple remote systems simultaneously with output aggregation.
Credential vault: Securely store passwords, SSH keys, and certificates with encrypted local storage.
Connection sharing: Export and import connection profiles to share configurations across teams or devices.
Multi-platform support: Run on Windows, macOS, and Linux with consistent functionality and interface.
Session history: Review past connections and commands with searchable logs and quick reconnect options.
Environment variables: Define and inject environment variables per connection for consistent remote workflows.
Custom protocols: Extend functionality with plugins to support additional connection types and tools.
